identification.cap: 1.57-5.12 inches, hemispherical to plano-convex umbonate, whitish to pale gray-brown, fibrillose to shaggy-scaly, dry, thick flesh, margin incurved fringed then upturned.
identification.flesh: White, sometimes grey-tan near cuticle, no stain.
identification.gills: Free, white to cream, crowded, 4-5 tiers lamellulae, unchanging.
identification.stem: 1.97-3.94 inches long, 0.59-0.98 inches thick, club-shaped to spindle-shaped rooted, white with appressed fibrils, browns slowly, stuffed to hollow, large membranous white ring.
identification.microscopic: Spores 6-9 × 4-5 µm ellipsoid to ovoid smooth dextrinoid no germ pore; basidia 22-25 × 5-6 µm clavate 4-sterigmate; cheilocystidia 30-50 × 6-16 µm clavate cylindric subutriform; pileipellis cutis gelatinizing 2.5-7.5 µm; no clamps.

habitat: Saprobic, solitary/scattered/small groups, disturbed ground, landscaped areas, roadsides, grassy areas, agricultural fields, back dunes, compost heaps, drier soils but moist in compost/irrigated fields, late summer to fall, West Coast North America, rare in Europe and Australia.
